{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resource & Office Admin",
  "description": "Talenture Group is an Executive Search Group with brands focused on mid - senior level recruitments for specific markets. At Talenture Group, we specialize in connecting exceptional talent with top organizations across Nigeria. Our mission is to provide innovative recruitment solutions while fostering a culture of growth and collaboration.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Human Resource &amp; Office Admin

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time, Onsite

Job Description


	The HR &amp; Office Admin will provide comprehensive human resources leadership while ensuring smooth day-to-day office administration.
	This role will be responsible for managing HR policies, recruitment, performance management, compliance, and employee engagement, alongside overseeing office operations, vendor management, and administrative support to the Managing Director.
	The position requires a certified HR professional with strong organizational and people management skills.


Responsibilities
Human Resources Management:


	Develop, implement, and update HR policies, procedures, and employee handbook in line with best practices and local labor laws.
	Manage end-to-end recruitment, onboarding, and exit processes.
	Drive performance management processes, including appraisals, goal setting, and career development.
	Oversee employee relations, conflict resolution, and disciplinary processes.
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian labor laws, pensions, tax, and statutory requirements.
	Lead staff training and development initiatives to build skills and capacity.
	Champion employee engagement, welfare, and culture-building initiatives.


Office &amp; Administrative Management:


	Oversee daily office operations to ensure a professional and efficient work environment.
	Manage office budgets, procurement, vendor relationships, and facilities.
	Coordinate company events, meetings, and internal communications.
	Provide administrative support to the Managing Director and leadership team.
	Maintain accurate records and documentation, including HR files and office inventory.
	Ensure IT, office systems, and logistics support smooth business operations.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in human resources, Business Administration, or related field. (minimum of second class upper)
	Minimum of 2 years of proven experience in HR and office administration, preferably within a professional services or consulting firm or fast paced environment.
	Professional HR Certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, CIPD, or equivalent) is mandatory.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor laws, compliance, and HR best practices.
	Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite and HR software/ERP systems.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and maintain confidentiality.


Key Competencies:


	Strong leadership and people management skills.
	High attention to detail and organizational ability.
	Problem-solving and conflict resolution capability.
	Professionalism, discretion, and integrity.
	Strong business acumen and ability to support firm-wide objectives.


Remuneration


	Salary: N300,000 - N400,000 / month
	Competitive salary and benefits package, commensurate with experience.&nbsp;
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-26",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Talenture Group"
    
  },

      "minValue": 250000,

Human Resource & Office Admin Job at Talenture Group




        
    

        
        Talenture Group is an Executive Search Group with brands focused on mid - senior level recruitments for specific markets. At Talenture Group, we specialize in connecting exceptional talent with top organizations across Nigeria. Our mission is to provide innovative recruitment solutions while fostering a culture of growth and collaboration.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource & Office Admin

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time, Onsite

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The HR & Office Admin will provide comprehensive human resources leadership while ensuring smooth day-to-day office administration.
	This role will be responsible for managing HR policies, recruitment, performance management, compliance, and employee engagement, alongside overseeing office operations, vendor management, and administrative support to the Managing Director.
	The position requires a certified HR professional with strong organizational and people management skills.


Responsibilities
Human Resources Management:


	Develop, implement, and update HR policies, procedures, and employee handbook in line with best practices and local labor laws.
	Manage end-to-end recruitment, onboarding, and exit processes.
	Drive performance management processes, including appraisals, goal setting, and career development.
	Oversee employee relations, conflict resolution, and disciplinary processes.
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian labor laws, pensions, tax, and statutory requirements.
	Lead staff training and development initiatives to build skills and capacity.
	Champion employee engagement, welfare, and culture-building initiatives.


Office & Administrative Management:


	Oversee daily office operations to ensure a professional and efficient work environment.
	Manage office budgets, procurement, vendor relationships, and facilities.
	Coordinate company events, meetings, and internal communications.
	Provide administrative support to the Managing Director and leadership team.
	Maintain accurate records and documentation, including HR files and office inventory.
	Ensure IT, office systems, and logistics support smooth business operations.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in human resources, Business Administration, or related field. (minimum of second class upper)
	Minimum of 2 years of proven experience in HR and office administration, preferably within a professional services or consulting firm or fast paced environment.
	Professional HR Certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, CIPD, or equivalent) is mandatory.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor laws, compliance, and HR best practices.
	Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite and HR software/ERP systems.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and maintain confidentiality.


Key Competencies:


	Strong leadership and people management skills.
	High attention to detail and organizational ability.
	Problem-solving and conflict resolution capability.
	Professionalism, discretion, and integrity.
	Strong business acumen and ability to support firm-wide objectives.


Remuneration


	Salary: N300,000 - N400,000 / month
	Competitive salary and benefits package, commensurate with experience. 
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

	The Head of New Business &amp; Strategy will lead business growth by identifying new opportunities, driving pitches, and developing client strategies.


Key Responsibilities

	Lead proposals, pitch decks, and client presentations

	7&ndash;10 years of experience in advertising, strategy, or business development
	Proven success in winning pitches and driving revenue
	Strong communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.


Salary
N400,000 - N450,000 per month.",

Head of New Business & Strategy Job at HR-on-Wheels




        
    

        
        HR-on-Wheels is a Human Resource consulting firm with focus to add value to the businesses of SMEs by emphazing the need to have a people strategy in place.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of New Business & Strategy

Job Location: Mainland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	The Head of New Business & Strategy will lead business growth by identifying new opportunities, driving pitches, and developing client strategies.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and execute business growth strategies
	Identify and pursue high-value prospects
	Lead proposals, pitch decks, and client presentations
	Build strong client and partner relationships
	Collaborate with internal teams to deliver effective solutions
	Conduct market and competitor research


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in a related field
	7–10 years of experience in advertising, strategy, or business development
	Proven success in winning pitches and driving revenue
	Strong communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.


Salary
N400,000 - N450,000 per month.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Civil Engineer",
  "description": "Golden Oil Industries Limited was incorporated in Nigeria on 8th September, 1988, and has grown into a household name in Nigeria&#39;s edible oil&#39;s industry. The company&#39;s focus is to provide healthy oil as a cooking medium to its customers. The company is Nigeria&#39;s trusted name for supply of refined palm oil, palm kernel oil, olein, soybean Oil, stearin, soybean meal, soy lecithin, and palm kernel de-oiled cake. Our oils are used as healthy cooking medium. Soybean meal and palm kernel de-oiled cake are used in premier poultry / animal feed.

The company&#39;s products have been duly certified by the appropriate regulatory agencies Such as the National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC), Standard Organization of Nigeria (SON) and National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency (NESREA). Golden Oil has modern processing technology and plants, which can be compared to worldwide standards. The company has highly trained seasoned oil experts, who&#39;s commitment is to delivering healthy oil to Nigerian consumers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Civil Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Delta
Employment Type: Full Time

Responsibilities


	Design and develop project plans, specifications, estimates and scope of work.
	Execute project plans
	Conduct site investigations and analyze survey reports
	Manage construction activities, ensuring compliance with regulations and standards
	Collaborate with architects, contractors, and stakeholders
	Conduct inspections and tests to ensure quality and safety
	Prepare project schedules, cost and ensure its within the budget
	Work with process, mechanical, electrical, and instrumentation engineers
	Oversee soil testing to establish soil strength and the feasibility of the building
	Prepare progress reports and documentation.


Key Result Areas (KRA)
The key result areas of this role are:


	Project management
	Project delivery
	Design and engineering
	Quality of delivery and safety of the site
	Budget and cost Management
	Innovation &amp; problem solving
	Compliance to regulatory standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree/HND in Civil engineering, construction or project management
	Minimum of three years progressive experience in civil engineering work/project management and site development
	Strong analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills
	Knowledge of project management tools (e.g., MS Project, Primavera)
	Knowledge of building codes, regulations, and standards
	Ability to read structural analysis and design
	Understanding of construction methods and materials
	Time management and organization
	Attention to detail and quality control
	Good Reporting skills
	Adaptability and flexibility
	Team player.&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;


The key result areas of this role are:


	Project management
	Project delivery
	Design and engineering
	Quality of delivery and safety of the site
	Budget and cost Management
	Innovation &amp; problem solving
	Compliance to regulatory standards.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Civil Engineer Job at Golden Oil Industries Limited




        
    

        
        
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

Golden Oil Industries Limited was incorporated in Nigeria on 8th September, 1988, and has grown into a household name in Nigeria's edible oil's industry. The company's focus is to provide healthy oil as a cooking medium to its customers. The company is Nigeria's trusted name for supply of refined palm oil, palm kernel oil, olein, soybean Oil, stearin, soybean meal, soy lecithin, and palm kernel de-oiled cake. Our oils are used as healthy cooking medium. Soybean meal and palm kernel de-oiled cake are used in premier poultry / animal feed.

The company's products have been duly certified by the appropriate regulatory agencies Such as the National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC), Standard Organization of Nigeria (SON) and National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency (NESREA). Golden Oil has modern processing technology and plants, which can be compared to worldwide standards. The company has highly trained seasoned oil experts, who's commitment is to delivering healthy oil to Nigerian consumers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer

Job Location: Delta
Employment Type: Full Time

Responsibilities


	Design and develop project plans, specifications, estimates and scope of work.
	Execute project plans
	Conduct site investigations and analyze survey reports
	Manage construction activities, ensuring compliance with regulations and standards
	Collaborate with architects, contractors, and stakeholders
	Conduct inspections and tests to ensure quality and safety
	Prepare project schedules, cost and ensure its within the budget
	Work with process, mechanical, electrical, and instrumentation engineers
	Oversee soil testing to establish soil strength and the feasibility of the building
	Prepare progress reports and documentation.


Key Result Areas (KRA)
The key result areas of this role are:


	Project management
	Project delivery
	Design and engineering
	Quality of delivery and safety of the site
	Budget and cost Management
	Innovation & problem solving
	Compliance to regulatory standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree/HND in Civil engineering, construction or project management
	Minimum of three years progressive experience in civil engineering work/project management and site development
	Strong analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills
	Knowledge of project management tools (e.g., MS Project, Primavera)
	Knowledge of building codes, regulations, and standards
	Ability to read structural analysis and design
	Understanding of construction methods and materials
	Time management and organization
	Attention to detail and quality control
	Good Reporting skills
	Adaptability and flexibility
	Team player.                                                                                                            


The key result areas of this role are:


	Project management
	Project delivery
	Design and engineering
	Quality of delivery and safety of the site
	Budget and cost Management
	Innovation & problem solving
	Compliance to regulatory standards.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@activa.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the

  "description": "Boulevard Hotels and Resorts is a distinguished hotel development, management, and franchise company with a visionary approach to the African hospitality landscape.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Digital Marketing Specialist

Job Location:&nbsp;Asokoro, Abuja
Job type: Full-time (On-site)

Role Description


	This is a full-time, on-site role based in Asokoro, for a Digital Marketing Specialist.
	Responsibilities include developing and executing comprehensive digital marketing strategies to drive online engagement, enhancing the brand&#39;s digital presence, and optimizing web traffic.
	The role also involves managing social media accounts, analyzing web traffic data using analytics tools, and executing online marketing campaigns.
	The specialist will collaborate with internal teams to create digital content and ensure communication strategies align with business objectives.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Marketing, Business, Communication, or related field
	Strong skills in Social Media Marketing and Online Marketing to effectively manage campaigns and improve audience engagement
	Proficiency in Digital Marketing and Web Analytics to design, optimize, and evaluate marketing strategies based on performance metrics
	Excellent Communication skills for clear collaboration across teams and creating engaging messaging for campaigns
	Ability to work independently in a dynamic environment while meeting deadlines and achieving marketing goals
	Experience in the hospitality industry and familiarity with local markets are advantageous.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@boulevardhotelgroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Digital Marketing Specialist Job at Boulevard Hotels and Resorts




        
    

        
        Boulevard Hotels and Resorts is a distinguished hotel development, management, and franchise company with a visionary approach to the African hospitality landscape.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Marketing Specialist

Job Location: Asokoro, Abuja
Job type: Full-time (On-site)

Role Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This is a full-time, on-site role based in Asokoro, for a Digital Marketing Specialist.
	Responsibilities include developing and executing comprehensive digital marketing strategies to drive online engagement, enhancing the brand's digital presence, and optimizing web traffic.
	The role also involves managing social media accounts, analyzing web traffic data using analytics tools, and executing online marketing campaigns.
	The specialist will collaborate with internal teams to create digital content and ensure communication strategies align with business objectives.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, Communication, or related field
	Strong skills in Social Media Marketing and Online Marketing to effectively manage campaigns and improve audience engagement
	Proficiency in Digital Marketing and Web Analytics to design, optimize, and evaluate marketing strategies based on performance metrics
	Excellent Communication skills for clear collaboration across teams and creating engaging messaging for campaigns
	Ability to work independently in a dynamic environment while meeting deadlines and achieving marketing goals
	Experience in the hospitality industry and familiarity with local markets are advantageous.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@boulevardhotelgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Auditor, IT",
  "description": "Stanbic IBTC Bank is a leading African banking group focused on emerging markets globally. It has been a mainstay of South Africa&#39;s financial system for 150 years, and now spans 16 countries across the African continent.

Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, we are looking for resourceful individuals to join our dedicated team at our offices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Auditor, IT

Job Ref ID: 80447432A-0001
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time
Business Segment: Group Functions

Job Description


	To execute the audit process effectively within relevant stakeholder environments by demonstrating a clear understanding to independently and objectively provide assurance and advice that enables client centric risk management.&nbsp;
	To review and assess in collaboration with Audit Leads, the high-risk areas of the business in order to give assurance to the Group Audit Committee, Business Executives and Shareholders that good governance practices are in place and internal controls are exercised throughout the financial period.


Key Responsibilities


	Understand detailed business process activities as well as activities performed in enabling functions that support these.
	Understand annual key risk concerns for the business area as well as industry and latest trends impacting risk and control practices.
	Identify and recommend areas of improvement (to accountable process owners) in the control environment of your allocated audit portfolio and other areas of the group.
	Deliver allocated components of the audit/advisory/proactive assurance assignment and report on these according to the GIA methodology and GIA quality standards.
	Report key issues or audit findings accurately in a succinct, impactful manner, clearly articulate and substantiate materiality or significance of the risk and its impact.
	Recommend appropriate corrective action and obtain management commitments for correctives actions and record these accurately as agreed.&nbsp;


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, or Cybersecurity (preferred).&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;
	Professional qualifications like CISA, CISM, ORACLE Database and CISCO Networking.


Experience Required:


	5&ndash;7 years of experience in IT infrastructure, IT control frameworks, cloud technologies, emerging technologies, and data analytics.
	Strong knowledge of relevant laws and regulations and their impact on IT systems.
	In-depth understanding of banking systems, procedures, and modern internal auditing practices.


Additional Information:
Behavioural Competencies:


	Adopting Practical Approaches
	Articulating Information
	Checking Things
	Developing Expertise
	Documenting Facts
	Examining Information
	Interacting with People
	Interpreting Data
	Meeting Timescales
	Producing Output
	Team Working
	Upholding Standards


Technical Competencies:


	Audit Project Management
	Audit Report Writing
	IA Data Analysis
	IA Technology Application
	Internal Auditing
	Maintain IA Professional Practices
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-26",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-27",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "name": "Stanbic IBTC Bank"
    
  },

Auditor, IT Job at Stanbic IBTC Bank




        
    

        
        Stanbic IBTC Bank is a leading African banking group focused on emerging markets globally. It has been a mainstay of South Africa's financial system for 150 years, and now spans 16 countries across the African continent.

Standard Bank is a firm believer in technical innovation, to help us guarantee exceptional client service and leading edge financial solutions. Our growing global success reflects our commitment to the latest solutions, the best people, and a uniquely flexible and vibrant working culture. To help us drive our success into the future, we are looking for resourceful individuals to join our dedicated team at our offices.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Auditor, IT
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Ref ID: 80447432A-0001
Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time
Business Segment: Group Functions

Job Description


	To execute the audit process effectively within relevant stakeholder environments by demonstrating a clear understanding to independently and objectively provide assurance and advice that enables client centric risk management. 
	To review and assess in collaboration with Audit Leads, the high-risk areas of the business in order to give assurance to the Group Audit Committee, Business Executives and Shareholders that good governance practices are in place and internal controls are exercised throughout the financial period.


Key Responsibilities


	Understand detailed business process activities as well as activities performed in enabling functions that support these.
	Understand annual key risk concerns for the business area as well as industry and latest trends impacting risk and control practices.
	Identify and recommend areas of improvement (to accountable process owners) in the control environment of your allocated audit portfolio and other areas of the group.
	Deliver allocated components of the audit/advisory/proactive assurance assignment and report on these according to the GIA methodology and GIA quality standards.
	Report key issues or audit findings accurately in a succinct, impactful manner, clearly articulate and substantiate materiality or significance of the risk and its impact.
	Recommend appropriate corrective action and obtain management commitments for correctives actions and record these accurately as agreed. 


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, or Cybersecurity (preferred).                                                                   
	Professional qualifications like CISA, CISM, ORACLE Database and CISCO Networking.


Experience Required:


	5–7 years of experience in IT infrastructure, IT control frameworks, cloud technologies, emerging technologies, and data analytics.
	Strong knowledge of relevant laws and regulations and their impact on IT systems.
	In-depth understanding of banking systems, procedures, and modern internal auditing practices.


Additional Information:
Behavioural Competencies:


	Adopting Practical Approaches
	Articulating Information
	Checking Things
	Developing Expertise
	Documenting Facts
	Examining Information
	Interacting with People
	Interpreting Data
	Meeting Timescales
	Producing Output
	Team Working
	Upholding Standards


Technical Competencies:


	Audit Project Management
	Audit Report Writing
	IA Data Analysis
	IA Technology Application
	Internal Auditing
	Maintain IA Professional Practices
